docs.lead_paragraph: ALTHOUGH that extremely prolific writer, Mr. E.F. Benson, has written tales with their scenes laid in many different places and many different countries, he is perhaps fondest of telling of those little English country towns where there is a "society" composed of about a dozen, or perhaps even less than a dozen, people, who are, of course, obliged to see one another almost constantly.

headline.main: Latest Works of Fiction; MISS HAPP. By E.F. Benson George H. Doran Company. $1.75.

docs.abstract: Stringer, Arth, The City of Peril

docs.lead_paragraph: Dr. Royal S. Copeland, Health Commissioner, replied yesterday to the letter of Robert S. Brinkerd, Vice President of the Committee on Public Relations of the Eastern Railroads, in which he was criticised for stating that certain railroads were to a great extent responsible for the present coal shortage.

headline.main: COPELAND REPLIES SHARPLY TO BINKERD; Says Coal Situation Should Be Considered in Terms of Human Lives, Not Economics.
